SENT.plain: A 16-year-old boy with Behçet's disease who was seen with thrombophlebitis of the leg was found to have coronary artery occlusion with postinfarction left ventricular aneurysm
Recurrent femoral artery aneurysms and orogenital ulceration developed in him
The diagnostic features together with successful treatment of this patient and a discussion of Behçet's syndrome are presented
